question: How many Indian beaches have been given the “Blue Flag” certification?
explanation:
Eight beaches of India have been given the international 'Blue Flag' certification. The decision has been made by an international jury comprising members from IUCN, UNWTO, UNEP and FEE.
These beaches are Shivrajpur (Dwarka-Gujarat), Ghoghla (Diu), Kasarkod and Padubidri (Karnataka), Kappad (Kerala), Rushikonda (AP), Golden (Puri-Odisha) and Radhanagar (A&N Islands).
